Key Match Events: CJ McCollum followed up his 50-point Friday outing with 25 points on Sunday, shooting 6/11 from beyond the arc.
Trey Murphy scored 22 points, including three slam dunks and four three-pointers, before exiting the game with a left ankle injury in the third quarter.
Dejounte Murray recorded his first triple-double as a Pelican with 14 points, 10 rebounds, and 12 assists.
Yves Missi had 16 points, 7 rebounds, and 3 blocks in his matchup against Washington's Alex Sarr.
Post-Match Reflections: CJ McCollum expressed his determination to be aggressive and efficient to help the team win despite their tough record.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Pelicans made 18 three-pointers, a season high, and won their second straight game for the first time since October.
Washington's first-half points dropped from 68 on Friday to 45 on Sunday, indicating improved defense by the Pelicans.
